message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper deals with object categorization in images, which is a core problem in computer vision. The proposed approach involves learning specific receptive fields (RF's) or regions from multiple images, which is a common technique in computer vision and falls under the category of feature learning. The paper also proposes a similarity metric called pyramid-error distance (PED) to measure pairwise distances between RF's, which is a technique used in image matching and retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Other likely sub-categories include cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.MM (Multimedia), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), as these sub-categories are also relevant to the proposed approach.
